Quarter: The fiscal quarter and year when the data breach costs were reported. This helps in identifying the time period of the financial impact.
Data Breach Cost: The total financial cost associated with data breaches for the specified quarter. This is crucial for understanding the monetary impact of breaches.
Mitigation Strategy: The strategy or measures taken to mitigate the impact of the data breach. This provides context on how the company responds to such incidents.
Impact on Compliance: Indicates whether the data breach had any impact on the company's compliance status. This is important in maintaining regulatory standards.

Mitigation Strategy: Partnered with a cybersecurity firm for monitoring
Updated data backup and recovery plans
Enhanced security protocols and employee training
Upgraded firewall and intrusion detection systems
